page.title: 01KNOCKHILL 'B'
page.content: The landscape of block 03040693 Knockhill is hilly and undulating in the South West, and there is a large marshy area in Outh Muir in the North East. This area lies to the North West of Dunfermline in West Fife the lowest point is 223 metres in the South East to 364 metres at the summit of Knockhill. The land is mainly used for sheep and cattle rearing, but there is evidence of earlier coal mining in the area. A racing circuit has been established on the slopes of Knockhill and both motor cycling and car racing takes place here. Few people live in the area and they are mainly farm workers. There are radio communications masts on Knockhill and the A 823 is the only road that crosses the area from the South East to the North West.
